intro: Phlomoides rastagalensis, commonly known as the Rastafarian phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of blue and purple. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Phlomoides rastagalensis is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous habitats.
